description: Dive into "Capturing D√ºsseldorf: A Photogenic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing D√ºsseldorf: A Photogenic Journey

places.generalDescription: The Rhine Tower, also known as Rheinturm, is a must-visit attraction in Dusseldorf. This futuristic tower features an observation deck and a revolving restaurant offering stunning city views. Situated on the banks of the Rhine River near Media Harbor, it provides a unique dining experience with a 360-degree panorama of the city skyline from nearly 170 meters above ground. Designed by architect H.

sources.snippet: The Rhine Tower is one of the more photographed places in Dusseldorf because of its imposing presence in the middle of the city. On a bright sunny day, taking a picture of the Rhine Tower for your ‚ÄòGram is as close to the perfect shot as possible. You‚Äôll definitely be able to find the Rhine Tower in Dusseldorf because of its size so snap away here!
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Dusseldorf

sources.snippet: The Rhine Tower is a must-visit spot in D√ºsseldorf if you're looking for Instagram-worthy photos. This iconic landmark offers stunning panoramic views of the city and the beautiful Rhine River. Located in the Medienhafen district, known for its modern architecture, the tower stands tall as a symbol of the city's modernity.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

sources.snippet: This one shouldn‚Äôt come as a surprise, the Living Bridge in the Media Harbour is always filled with Instagram fanatics and models taking shots looking out at the Rhine Tower and the Frank O‚Äô Gehry Zollhof buildings.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: Some of you might want to take your river appreciation a step further than simply strolling the banks ‚Äì the Rhine Tower is for you.
sources.shortName: 15 Top Things To Do In D√ºsseldorf: Culture, Food, History And Exploration!
Explore the Instaworthy Spots of Dusseldorf with a Local

places.name: Rhine Tower

reviews.text:
D√ºsseldorf with a group of four friends. We booked our tickets online in advance, which made the process quick and easy. When we arrived, everything was well organized. It took about 30 minutes to get up to the observation deck, including waiting time and the elevator ride, which wasn't too bad at all.

Once we got to the top, the view was absolutely worth it. You can see the entire city of D√ºsseldorf from up there, including the Rhine River, old town, and beyond. It wasn't too crowded when we went, which made the experience more relaxing and enjoyable. We had plenty of space to take photos and enjoy the scenery without feeling rushed or overwhelmed.

There's also a nice restaurant and bar at the top. The atmosphere was calm and modern, and it's a great spot if you want to enjoy a drink or snack while admiring the view. Prices are a bit higher, as expected for a tourist spot, but the experience makes up for it.

Overall, visiting the Rhine Tower was a highlight of our trip. I definitely recommend it for anyone spending time in D√ºsseldorf.

Good value, great views. Liked the slanted windows- perfect for placing your phone against at just the right angle. It was also half the price of the Euro tower in Amsterdam, which had worse views. Go before midday! It's cheaper then

Great sight seeing attraction when in Dusseldorf. At 168 meters high the panorama restaurant offers great views of the city, surrounding cities and landscape and the nearby boats navigating the rhine river.
Highly recommend booking ticket in advance, as even in off-holidays season its sometimes sold out.

places.generalDescription: Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf is a unique venue located in a converted warehouse in Dusseldorf, Germany. It serves as a hub for classic car enthusiasts, offering a variety of attractions such as classic car showrooms, repair and restoration facilities, parts shops, auto storage spaces, and stores selling auto-related clothing and gifts. The venue also features glass storage 'boxes' where owners can securely store their cars while still making them visible to visitors.

sources.snippet: An historic roundhouse for locomotives finds a new calling as the home of Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf, a center for all things relating to classic cars. It's a car-lover's paradise and is really a combination show room, repair and restoration facility, parts shop, auto storage facility, and shop for auto-related clothing and gifts. A particularly unusual feature is the number of glass storage "boxes" where owners can store cars securely while leaving them visible to aficionados.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Dusseldorf

places.name: Classic Remise D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text: Super cool car exhibition, and entrance is completely free!! Great spot for cool pictures. The facility has a restaurant to eat and have a drink. It also offers cool experiences like f1 simulators. There is also a very cool store where you can buy racing caps, jackets, etc. 100% I would recommend this place.

I love this place. Each time I visited D√ºsseldorf, I was there too. It is paradise of car enthusiasts. If you love car as me. Do not miss this place.
It is one the best place to buy classic or sport cars.

I love this place. We come from Belgium and we love oldtimer cars. Every time we see all these beautiful car on the road. They always have German license plate and I love seeing them.

Today we got a chance to visit it here and I was so so so happy. All these cars are amazing. It's really like a dream for a lot of people to see all these beautiful cars.

It's a really nice place to visit and definitely gave me more inspiration to save money to own one of this in the future! ü§£

But really I love this place so muchü•∫

places.generalDescription: Hofgarten is a serene and picturesque green space located in the heart of the city. As Germany's first and oldest park, it offers nearly 70 acres of lush meadows, ancient trees, ponds, fountains, and beautiful walking paths along the Dussel canal.

sources.snippet: To the north of D√ºsseldorf's city center is the Hofgarten, a large park laid out in 1770 that stretches all the way from the Old Town and K√∂nigsallee to the banks of the River Rhine. Designed in the English landscape style, this lovely 68-acre site includes extensive meadows and wooded areas, as well as numerous streams and ponds. Among its many notable buildings is the Baroque Hofg√§rtnerhaus, or Court Gardener House, former home of garden architect Maximilian Weyhe and now housing the city's Theatre Museum (Theatermuseum D√ºsseldorf).
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Dusseldorf

sources.snippet: Der Hofgarten ist nicht nur der erste und √§lteste Volksgarten Deutschlands, sondern auch die gr√ºne Lunge D√ºsseldorfs. Die nat√ºrliche Br√ºcke von Stadtmitte nach Pempelfort umfasst auf knapp 28 Hektar eine Mischung aus streng-barocken Gartenstil und englischen Landschaftsgarten und ist somit ein zentraler Anlaufpunkt f√ºr eine kurze Auszeit vom chaotischen Stadtget√ºmmel. Im Fr√ºhling ist der Hofgarten beliebter Spot f√ºr das Fotomotive mit den herrlich sch√∂nen Kirschbl√ºten.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Foto-Locations in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: Eine gr√ºne Oase in der D√ºsseldorfer Innenstadt ist der Hofgarten mit einer Fl√§che von knapp 28 Hektar. Der √§lteste Teil des Gartens wurde im Jahr 1769 im franz√∂sisch-klassischen Stil angelegt ‚Äì damit ist der D√ºsseldorfer Hofgarten Deutschlands erster und √§ltester Volksgarten. In der Parkanlage findet man verschiedene Stile von Gartenbaukunst, z.B.
sources.shortName: Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten & die sch√∂nsten Fotospots

sources.snippet: The park complex was originally intended to be a free place for local residents to relax (the first in the country at the time). The landscaped area was made famous by the Neanderthal museum, an artificial lake, numerous sculptures, fountains and shady alleys.
sources.shortName: Top 26 places to visit in Dusseldorf in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: Thanks to the volunteers at the Association Pro D√ºsseldorf, we are able to enjoy a beautiful band of blue/purple crocuses year after year along the Rheinpark, in Kaiserspfalz, and in the Hofgarten.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf
15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

places.name: Hofgarten

reviews.text: A beautiful green lunge in the city center. Wonderful walking routes and places to sit and absorb nature. In sunny days you'll find a lot of people sitting on the grass for picnic or just to enjoy some rays of sun. You can visit the swan house where they feed the poultry.highly recommended

Visited Hofgarten for the first time, and I must say, it's such a beautiful and peaceful park. The greenery, old trees, and little water streams give it a very calming vibe. It's a great spot to just sit, walk around, or even read a book if you want some quiet time.
What I liked most was how clean and well maintained it is. Even though it's in the middle of the city, it doesn't feel crowded or noisy at all. It's perfect for a short escape from the usual hustle. I'd definitely recommend visiting if you're in D√ºsseldorf. it's totally worth it!
Nice park and the view is amazing. You can relax in there and enjoy nature while walking around and enjoying your time with your friends.

places.generalDescription: Nord Park is a well-known and expansive park in Dusseldorf, featuring themed gardens, fountains, shade trees, and walking paths. It was originally planned for the Reich Exhibition Schaffendes Volk in 1936 and opened in 1937. The park offers broad walkways, biking lanes, waterways, playgrounds, and a famous Japanese Garden.

sources.snippet: A post shared by l u i s a (@luisa.germer) on Oct 16, 2017 at 7:48am PDT. A Japanese-style oasis. There are traces of Europe‚Äôs largest community of Japanese expatriates throughout Dusseldorf.
sources.shortName: 10 Most-Instagrammable Places in D√ºsseldorf to See Right Now

sources.snippet: Nordpark, one of the most beautiful parks in Dusseldorf, is a picturesque public park that spans over 36.6 hectares (90.4 acres). Filled with glistening ponds, fountains, and sculptures, Nordpark offers plenty of opportunities for stunning Instagram photos. One of its standout features is the Japanese Garden, which adds an element of tranquility to the already scenic surroundings.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

places.name: Nord Park

reviews.text:
Very beautiful, huge  and well kept park. The fountains are very mesmerising. Many benches to relax. Great children play areas on both sides.

Just a tip, walk few metres from entrance n turn right for fountains if you are not able to walk much.
Is a beautiful park to just unwind and soak up the sun, or just enjoy some quiet time. Easy to get to
Nice place to relax and enjoying a quiet afternoon in the shade or sun if you want to catch up on it. The japanese garden at the back is pretty nice and the atmosphere is calming.

places.generalDescription: Rheinpark Golzheim, also known as the Rheinpark, is a picturesque city park located along the banks of the Rhine River in Dusseldorf. Spanning 24 hectares, this expansive park offers stunning views of the Rheinknie, Oberkassel, and Theodor-Heuss bridges. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the 2.5-kilometer riverside promenade or relax on the vast green lawns while taking in panoramic river vistas.

sources.snippet: Thanks to the volunteers at the Association Pro D√ºsseldorf, we are able to enjoy a beautiful band of blue/purple crocuses year after year along the Rheinpark, in Kaiserspfalz, and in the Hofgarten.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: Rheinpark Golzheim

reviews.text: Rheinpark is an enchanting oasis where nature's beauty unfolds in every season. The sight of seasonal flowers in full bloom is nothing short of breathtaking. The meticulous landscaping creates a vibrant tapestry of colors, making it a picturesque haven for relaxation and appreciation. A perfect escape to witness the ever-changing charm of nature. A visit to Rheinpark is truly an experience that rejuvenates the soul!
it looked to me like the happiest place on earth, with lots of people having a great time.

Visiting this public park is always a pleasant experience, providing a welcome escape from the everyday hustle. The well-maintained green spaces offer ample room for relaxation and recreation, making it ideal for families and individuals alike. Various amenities, such as playgrounds and walking paths, further enhance the overall appeal of this beautiful location. Furthermore, the park's cleanliness and tranquil atmosphere contribute to a positive and enjoyable visit. Overall, it's a fantastic spot to unwind and connect with nature.

places.generalDescription: Schloss Benrath, also known as Benrath Palace, is a stunning 18th-century pink palace showcasing the Baroque architectural style. The palace features original interiors and is surrounded by ornate gardens and a picturesque lake. Visitors can explore two museums within the palace: the Museum of European Garden Art and the Museum of Natural History, which house an impressive collection of sculptures, artwork, paintings, and artifacts from the 18th century.

sources.shortName: 10 Most-Instagrammable Places in D√ºsseldorf to See Right Now

sources.snippet: Auch fernab vom Stadtleben findest du einen perfekten Foto-Spot in D√ºsseldorf. Der Schlosspark Benrath ist sowohl denkmalgesch√ºtzt als auch Naturschutzgebiet. Und das nicht grundlos: Durch Artendiversit√§t und die Komposition des historischen Gartens mit der Architektur der Maison de Plaisance erstrecken sich die 61 Hektar zu einem Gesamtkunstwerk.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Foto-Locations in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: Schloss Benrath, a Baroque-style pleasure palace in D√ºsseldorf, shines with its pink-colored exterior and lush gardens. Dating back to 1770, this landmark has become a hot spot for both local and international photographers. Many admire its architectural beauty while strolling through the seemingly endless green spaces that surround the palace.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

sources.snippet: Built in 1770, Schloss Benrath is the place to go to for fantastic gardens and a pristine, pink-coloured exterior building. Once inside, you‚Äôll be treated to more Instagrammable shots with rooms decorated with 18th century decor. If there is one place you must visit in Dusseldorf for your Insta, let it be Schloss Benrath.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Dusseldorf

sources.snippet: F√ºr einen Besuch in D√ºsseldorf empfehle ich dir zwei kleine Schl√∂sser. Das rosafarbene Schloss Benrath erinnert ein bisschen an Versailles und liegt ca. 20 Minuten (per Stra√üenbahn oder Zug/S-Bahn) vom Zentrum entfernt.
sources.shortName: entdecke meine 18 besten Instagram-Spots

sources.snippet: Schloss Benrath (also known as the Pink Castle to many) is a popular place for wedding photographers to do their photoshoots.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf
15 Top Things To Do In D√ºsseldorf: Culture, Food, History And Exploration!

places.name: Schloss Benrath

reviews.text:
Free entry to the gorgeous park grounds surrounding the 18th century palace.

From highly manicured French gardens to a naturalistic English garden, from shaded paths along wilderness to a decent-sized playground, this place has something for all ages.

It will give you the illusion of being on the set of historical shows or movies.

The caf√© is worth a visit. Just the view is worth every penny. I consider the drink and housemade cake a free throw-in.

I had a wonderful experience visiting the castle - it's absolutely beautiful and rich with history. The gardens surrounding the castle are stunning and very well maintained, and the best part is they are free to enter. There's a lovely caf√© nearby that serves excellent coffee and delicious cakes, perfect for a relaxing break.

I highly recommend purchasing your tickets online - not only is it more convenient, but they're also a euro cheaper than buying them at the ticket counter. It's also a good idea to arrive an hour or two earlier than your ticket time so you can take a leisurely stroll through the gardens. The area is peaceful, with plenty of birds to watch - a real treat for nature lovers.

The ticket also includes access to two nearby museums: the Museum of Garden Styles and another dedicated to the region's flora and fauna. Overall, it's a fantastic day out, blending history, nature, and a bit of culture. Highly recommend!

this place is SO pretty, worth the 12‚Ç¨, definitely. easy to find, very organised, very beautiful, the guy who checked my ticket spoke kinda fast so I couldn't really understand what he said but as long as you wear the slippers, take pictures without flash, not touch stuff, not eat and be relatively quiet you'll be fine (basically respect the place). also definitely scan the QR code and listen to the guide taking you through the rooms, it adds a lot to the experience !

places.generalDescription: The Japanese Garden in Nordpark, Dusseldorf is a serene and tranquil oasis designed by landscape architect Iwakii Ishiguro. Spanning 36.6 hectares, the park features wide pathways ideal for walking and biking, vibrant flower beds, shaded ponds, fountains, and themed gardens. The Japanese Garden offers a slice of traditional Japan with its maples, black pines, gravel-bordered ponds, sculptures, and traditional seating.

sources.snippet: Among the more unusual things to do in D√ºsseldorf is to take a stroll through a serene Japanese garden. One of D√ºsseldorf's most popular parks ‚Äì and at 90 acres, one of its largest ‚Äì Nordpark is crisscrossed by wide pathways through its spacious lawns and themed gardens, including the lovely Lily Garden. The large Japanese Garden, presented to the city by D√ºsseldorf's Japanese community, has an astonishing variety of landscapes.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Dusseldorf
15 Top Things To Do In D√ºsseldorf: Culture, Food, History And Exploration!

places.name: Japanese Garden

reviews.text:
went there a couple of days ago with a friend to explore because we've heard of how beautiful it is and I was not disappointed! such a well kept green area with lots of space to wander and wonderful views. Not at all crowded even though it was around sunset. Some people were there walking their dogs or riding their bikes, u get a cool view of the Rhein right across the street.
10/10 would go again :)
Smal but fantastic Japanese Garden with old tradition. Placed with harmony between different neighborhoods gardens. You can relax with family and spent nice time. Have a fun.

We visited the Japanese Garden in early March, but unfortunately, there wasn't much to see. The pond was still dried out, and the overall atmosphere didn't quite give off the expected Japanese vibe, aside from a few decorative elements. It might be worth visiting later in the year when the garden is more lively and in full bloom.

places.generalDescription: Fortuna-B√ºdchen is a beloved gem nestled along the Rhine, serving as an informal gathering spot for locals and visitors alike. This charming kiosk has become synonymous with after-work relaxation, where friends and family can enjoy ice-cold beers while soaking in breathtaking sunset views. The vibrant atmosphere draws crowds on sunny days, making it a lively place to unwind.

sources.snippet: Along the edge of the Rhine (more specifically, next to the popular Fortuna B√ºdchen) is a perfect spot to sit and watch the sunset while drinking a couple of beers with friends and family. This spot is also the perfect spot for an Instagram selfie while the sun is going down.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: Fortuna-B√ºdchen

reviews.text: What a great place! As a foreigner with a little bike city trip, I passed by this food truck yesterday and decided to ride back today and try out the food. It's very Deutsche indeed! Love it. Might go tmr again for the Br√∂chen sandwich üòã
Gorgeous spot on the Rhine for a cold drink while watching the world go by. Busy and very good service. Drinks are very reasonable and the atmosphere on a sunny day was lovely.
Great place by the side of Rhine River

places.generalDescription: Burgplatz is a charming cobblestone square located on the banks of the Rhine River, just west of the Old Town. It was once home to a mighty fortress belonging to the counts of Berg and is now recognized as one of Germany's most beautiful post-war sites. Visitors can admire the remains of old military defense towers and explore the Marine Museum.

sources.snippet: Das Gebiet rund um den Burgplatz ist sehr belebt und hat uns richtig gut gefallen. Hier kann man sich ganz entspannt auf die gro√üe Rheintreppe setzen und das Geschehen an der Rheinuferpromenade beobachten. Auffallend auf dem Platz ist der runde Schlossturm, der das letzte √úberbleibsel des einstigen herzoglichen Schlosses ist, das bis 1872 bzw.
sources.shortName: Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten & die sch√∂nsten Fotospots

sources.snippet: As you approach the square, you will see the New Embankment clock, called the Green Matilda (date of creation - 19th century). Their column of granite is used as a water gauge. On the Burgplatz itself there are numerous Dusseldorf attractions, such as the Shipping Museum and the 14th century Dusseldorf Castle Outpost.
sources.shortName: Top 26 places to visit in Dusseldorf in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Burgplatz

reviews.text: Beautiful place! It's very nice to walk around on a late summer evening. Lots of old German architecture to see. There are many people around and there's a festive atmosphere with all of the beer gardens.

Sometimes the best way to explore a city is without a destination. During my visit to D√ºsseldorf, I simply wandered - from the charming old town streets to the wide open squares, tree-lined canals, and the peaceful riverside promenade.

The city feels both spacious and lively, with a blend of classic German architecture and modern touches.

I just had a few hours just to explore on foot with no fixed route. Let the city surprise me.

Used to be a nice place with the stairs to meet locals and hang out , but less so in the years since COVID. It's mostly tourists and homeless people now there, and too many festival tents .has more potential

places.generalDescription: K√∂-Bogen is a modern architectural marvel located in Dusseldorf, Germany. Designed by Daniel Liebeskind, this sleek facility features upscale shops and restaurants within its striking, ultramodern glass and white stone structure. The building stands out with its innovative design and urban functionality, offering green rooftop terraces and vibrant public spaces that showcase contemporary urban living and sustainability.

sources.snippet: Angrenzend an den Hofgarten pr√§gt der K√∂-Bogen seit 2021 die D√ºsseldorfer Innenstadt. Das von Daniel Libeskind entworfene Bauwerk ist zu einem modernen Wahrzeichen in D√ºsseldorf geworden: Die verspiegelten Fassaden, der wei√üe Naturstein, die diagonalen Schnitte und die Lage am Hofgarten laden zum Entdecken und Fotografieren ein. Im April 2024 habe ich zusammen mit dem Team der WDR Lokalzeit D√ºsseldorf den K√∂-Bogen auf seine Selfie-Tauglichkeit getestet.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Foto-Locations in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: The D√ºsseldorf downtown area has changed a lot over the past years. Walking along the K√∂nigsallee to the Hofgarten, a vast city park, you will see an example of ultramodern architecture. The K√∂-Bogen is a fancy building designed by Daniel Libeskind, with sharp diagonal cuts, built-in hanging gardens, and a mix of glass and white stones.
sources.shortName: 18 cool Instagram Sites in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: This architecturally pleasing building is the K√∂-Bogen, designed by famous architect Daniel Libeskind. The sharp diagonal cuts of the building, along with the hanging built-in gardens and the mix between the glass and white stone is what makes this building such a unique place for an Instagram shot.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

sources.snippet: You'll also explore the K√∂-Bogen, a shopping mall and office complex designed by Daniel Libeskind, and King's Alley, another picturesque spot for great Instagram snaps. The tour ends with a visit to the Media Harbor, a hub of inspiring architecture where the famous Neuer Zollhof can be found.
sources.shortName: Explore the Instaworthy Spots of Dusseldorf with a Local

places.name: K√∂-Bogen

reviews.text: D√ºsseldorf used to be such a dirty and dreary city. No longer. It is chic (and expensive) and architecturally truly stunning. Brilliant for pedestrians (hardly any room for the huge expensive German limousines which you can see crawling alongside the Koe(nigsallee). This area is particularly lovely in winter, and in summer you can sit in the park or watch the spring flowers.

Another fantastic building in D√ºsseldorf.
Rem khoolas is not living any detail to the case, and you can clearly see it in this magnificent building.
Unfortunately I didn't had the time to go inside.
The building is perfectly encased with the surrounding area, withe the pond on one side and the square in the other.
For architect lovers, another must see in this fantastic city.
The shopping mall is nice but the parking is very expensive and crowded so I only paid 3'90 Euros for entering and exiting with my car. Even though I didn't park ü•¥

places.generalDescription: The Botanical Garden in Dusseldorf, also known as Botanischer Garten Dusseldorf, is a paradise for nature enthusiasts and green thumbs alike. Situated on the grounds of the University Dusseldorf, this garden boasts an impressive collection of over 6,000 plant species from temperate climate zones. Visitors can explore a variety of gardens including an apothecary garden, Alpine garden, wildflower meadow, and beehives.

sources.snippet: Green thumbs will also enjoy the Botanical Garden of D√ºsseldorf (Botanischer Garten D√ºsseldorf). Located just to the south of the city center on the grounds of the University D√ºsseldorf, the gardens spotlight plants from temperate climate zones and also feature a domed hot house, wildflower meadow, beehives, and delightful apothecary and Alpine gardens. This impressive plant collection was established in 1974, and consists of more than 6,000 species.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Dusseldorf

places.name: Botanical Garden

reviews.text: Beautiful garden with different plants, flowers and birds. Highly recommended to stay in contact con nature and relax.

We expected to see more plants and greenery, but compared to other botanical gardens we've visited in Germany, there wasn't much to explore. It felt a bit underwhelming.

On the practical side, toilets are available in the basement of the dome, and the tram station is conveniently located at the North entrance of the garden.

Big diverse botanical garden and worth your visit, but when comparing to that in Bonn, not the same quality. Argument is that there is much waste of space, many trees and plants seem rather young, limited shade, and generally lacking the final design. Dome and the dragon threre there was superbly interesting, though. Close to four stars.

places.generalDescription: IDR Schloss Eller is an entertainment center in Dusseldorf, Germany that hosts various events such as consumer fairs and carnivals. It's a popular spot for trade shows, exhibitions, and trade fairs. The castle is surrounded by a moat and beautiful nature, making it a picturesque location perfect for capturing Instagram-worthy photos.

sources.snippet: Schloss Eller, a beautiful little castle surrounded by a moat and stunning nature, is considered one of the most Instagrammable spots in D√ºsseldorf. With its picturesque surroundings, it's no wonder that Schloss Eller has become a popular location for capturing photos. Whether you visit during the vibrant springtime when cherry blossoms are in bloom or in the golden hues of autumn, there is always an opportunity to capture the perfect shot at Schloss Eller.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

sources.snippet: Schloss Eller is a beautiful little castle surrounded by a moat and some stunning nature. The best time to visit for photography is in the spring when all the flowers are in bloom. The Schloss Eller park is gorgeous and makes for a wonderful Sunday stroll with the family as well.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: IDR Schloss Eller

reviews.text: Eller castle and its park are a lovely weekend destination. Wonderful for walks. The castle is easy to reach by tram or metro. Being not far from Benrath castle, this estate ist easy overlooked. Also its neighbourhood, Eller, does not enjoy the highest repution. It is worth a visit. Especially when you are living in Dusseldorf. Enjoy!
Walking around the the park wonderful. Very nice place to walk around with family and friends. Near beautiful water playground üõù surrounding frost good üòä

Very nice place to walk around with family and friends. You'll have a good conversations while walking along it's path. There are streams and cute little and big wildlife. There are playgrounds also for kids and kids at heart .

places.generalDescription: K√∂nigsallee, also known as "Ko" to the locals, is a prestigious avenue in Dusseldorf. It is renowned for its chic boutiques, exclusive hotels, and luxurious atmosphere. The area exudes wealth and sophistication, with a kilometer-long stretch of designer stores attracting well-dressed visitors. As the commercial heart of the city, it offers an array of high-end shopping experiences and upscale accommodations.

sources.snippet: An esplanade created in Classicist style, K√∂nigsallee is one of the most beautifully landscaped boulevards in Germany. High-end boutiques line both sides of the kilometer-long street‚Äîa place to see and be seen. You wouldn‚Äôt know you‚Äôre in the heart of the city, though, as traffic is split by canals with two iron bridges connecting the two sides of the street.
sources.shortName: 10 Most-Instagrammable Places in D√ºsseldorf to See Right Now

sources.snippet: The in orbit art installation is a popular exhibition at the K21 Kunstsammlung in D√ºsseldorf. It hangs more than 25 meters above the ground and is made of a multi-layered steel mesh, so you can walk through different levels while peering down at the people below.
sources.shortName: The 20 Best and Most "Instagrammable" Shots in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: K√∂nigsallee

reviews.text:
This is a wonderful Christmas market area , K√∂nigsalle, in D√ºsseldorf. I advise parking at the far end of K√∂nigsallee and walking up towards the busy end by the fountain. Parking is easier and you get to enjoy the views‚Ä¶the city is alive and full of style.
There is a row of kiosks BEFORE the fountain that have good stuff in them from souvenirs to Gl√ºhwein and food.
Be prepared for crowds‚Ä¶but enjoy the spirit.

Such a beautiful place to be to walk, shop, sit. A fantastic range of all kinds of shops from high-end designer shops to supermarkets, souvenier shops and bars and restaurants. A blend of old buildings and new. Bridges over the river and quirky statues. The hop on - hop off bus has stops here too and can highly recommend it as it takes you round the centre and also further out. A great place to be.

Beautiful place for a walk. Can be crowded during the day but more calm and romantic at evening time. You can find all stores and shops at the sidewalks from gym to food and clothes to independent professions. Easily accessible by all public transportation options.

places.generalDescription: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V. is a must-visit destination for architecture enthusiasts and culture lovers. Once a rundown commercial port, it has been revitalized into a vibrant hub for media, fashion, and creative industries. The area showcases an intriguing blend of old warehouses alongside modern architectural marvels by renowned architects like Frank Gehry and David Chipperfield.

sources.snippet: Medienhafen is a popular hotspot in D√ºsseldorf for Instagrammers and photographers. It offers a unique blend of modern architecture and historic buildings, making it visually appealing for photography enthusiasts. With its picturesque streets, Medienhafen provides plenty of opportunities to take photos in front of the Art Palace or explore the charming waterfront area.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Photo Spots In Dusseldorf For Your Instagram

sources.snippet: Der sogenannte Medienhafen liegt direkt an einem Rheinarm, nur eine kurze Fahrt mit dem Taxi oder der Stra√üenbahn vom Zentrum entfernt. Die Aussicht vom Ende des Medienhafens am Hyatt Regency Hotel ist atemberaubend. Du blickst auf den Rhein, den Rheinturm, die ber√ºhmten Gehry-Geb√§ude und das Rheinufer in der Altstadt.
sources.shortName: entdecke meine 18 besten Instagram-Spots

sources.snippet: This architectural hotspot is a must visit when you visit D√ºsseldorf. There are plenty of possibilities to get a nice picture here. The best time is at sunrise, as the light comes from behind the buildings and creates a beautiful golden glow.
sources.shortName: 8 x Instagram spots and photography in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: Medienhafen Dusseldorf e.V.

reviews.text: Great views, good for walk. To avoid crowd visit on Sunday. Unique buildings.
A great place to visit if its in the middle of the week,weekend is just full of tourist and many more. Try to visit during weekdays then you can enjoy more the view and have a lot of space.

The Rheinturm is definitely a must-see in D√ºsseldorf! From the top, you get a breathtaking panoramic view of the entire city. It's a unique experience, especially around sunset. You can also find a guide if you'd like to learn more about what you're seeing. There's a restaurant at the top as well-perfect for enjoying dinner with a stunning view. Highly recommended

places.address: c/o TIGGES Rechtsanw√§lte, Zollhof 8, 40219 D√ºsseldorf, Germany

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of D√ºsseldorf's Altstadt, the Town Hall is a historic gem that dates back to 1570-1573. With its impressive facade, it stands as a testament to the city's rich architectural heritage. Surrounded by charming old buildings and churches, including the iconic St. Lambertus Church and Castle Tower, this landmark offers visitors a glimpse into the past.

sources.snippet: The five-story building is made of pink brick, and is decorated with a hipped tower. Once inside the tower, you can climb up the spiral staircase. In the old days the Old Town Hall had an art gallery, craft and commercial warehouses and workshops.
sources.shortName: Top 26 places to visit in Dusseldorf in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Town Hall

reviews.text: The D√ºsseldorf Town Hall (Rathaus D√ºsseldorf) is a historic landmark located in the heart of the city. With its elegant Renaissance-style architecture and prominent location on the Marktplatz, it's a key site for those interested in the city's history. The building serves as the seat of the city's government and is often admired for its beautiful fa√ßade and the equestrian statue of Elector Jan Wellem in the square outside. A quick visit offers a glimpse into D√ºsseldorf's rich past and its civic pride.
Beautifully kept and modernized. Overlooking the square from two sides.
The Building was very beautiful.

places.generalDescription: The Kunstsammlung is a modern art collection housed in a renovated 19th-century building. The Standehaus am Kaiserteich, formerly the seat of the Parliament of North Rhine-Westphalia, was transformed into a contemporary art space in 2002. The museum features four wings with continuous arcades surrounding a spacious plaza and boasts a striking glazed domed roof that shapes the building's aesthetic.

sources.snippet: If you walk down the K√∂nigsallee towards the Intercontinental Hotel, you will see a majestic building in a little park. It is one of the most beautiful museums in D√ºsseldorf ‚Äì and there are many. Until the end of 2021, you can actively participate in the "in an orbit art installation," which hangs more than 25 meters above the ground and is made of a multi-layered steel mesh.
sources.shortName: 18 cool Instagram Sites in D√ºsseldorf

places.name: Kunstsammlung

reviews.text: This place is incredible not only because of that fun part where you go to the upper floor and walk on a metal metal mesh, but because of all the works of art you'll find here. This museum is super big, make sure to come with enough time to see everything.

Nice museum. Nice environment. Share my favorite painting here, the style is very special. I asked chatgpt to repaint the Battle of Alexander at Issus (the fourth picture) in this style (the first three pictures). In terms of real creation, AI is still far behind humans.

Stunning building and setting. You are tied to the installations and unfortunately this in place when we visited didn't fit our brief. We only just missed the ‚Äòclimbing on the roof' which was incredibly well received.

There is some lovely works but not all matched the beautiful setting.  It also wasn't very child friendly.

We travelled here using the D√ºsseldorf card (purchased from the tourist office - which includes lots of attractions and all travel and is HIGHLY recommended).

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of D√ºsseldorf's Altstadt, Bar Cherie offers a delightful escape from the bustling beer bars that surround it. This charming spot invites you to indulge in a glass of exquisite French wine while savoring delectable treats like quiche lorraine or rich mousse au chocolat, transporting you straight to Paris without leaving Germany. The ambiance is eclectic and inviting, with thoughtfully curated decor that makes for perfect photo opportunities.

sources.snippet: A post shared by KƒÄTE (@katharinamaria___) on Nov 2, 2017 at 11:16am PDT. An eclectic backdrop. Not all pubs look good in pictures but here, the owners have lovingly curated unique corners that make for fun shots.
sources.shortName: 10 Most-Instagrammable Places in D√ºsseldorf to See Right Now

places.name: Bar Cherie - D√ºsseldorf

reviews.text: We shared 0.5L of red wine which was very tasteful. The restaurant was fully packed on a Sunday night so we were lucky to walk in and get a spot inside. Very cozy atmosphere. Also the Gorgonzola Flammkuchen with Pear was really delicious.

What a place! Very cool and laid back crew. Everyone is so stylish. The drinks are very well made and very reasonably priced! The ambiance inside and outside is great! This is the perfect bar to have great drinks, awesome snacks and feel part of the action!

Looking for a decent glass of wine or cocktail later in the evening? This wine bar on Kurze Strasse is a lovely gathering place for meetings with friends or romantic dates. The wine menu offers an appealing selection of German and European wines, as well as good cocktails and non-alcoholic beverages. Light meals and snacks are also available until 10pm. At all a great bar and worth the experience. Enjoy!
